item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Monday, September 30, 2024 at 2:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Building a robust frontend using progressive enhancement (80 points | 13 comments)
2. Don’t believe the hype: AGI is far from inevitable (34 points | 20 comments)
3. On leaving my last job (leaving Apple) (51 points | 13 comments)
4. Prep: Golang comptime. Pure blasphemy (20 points | 9 comments)
5. The Public Domain Problem (26 points | 15 comments)
6. secure.py – Simplify HTTP Security Headers for Python Web Apps (Major Update) (4 points | 1 comment)
7. How 1 Software Engineer Outperforms 138 - Lichess Case Study (6 points | no comments)
8. runit-2.2.0 available (4 points | 1 comment)
9. 21 More AWS Services They Should Cancel (2 points | 2 comments)
10. Varlink Now (8 points | 5 comments)
11. Using undocumented Apple AI/ML instructions to get the average color of an image (6 points | no comments)
12. Use of Prolog for developing a new programming language (1992) (10 points | 3 comments)
13. We Have a Package for You! A Comprehensive Analysis of Package Hallucinations by Code Generating LLMs (6 points | no comments)
14. Notes on the Crystal language (48 points | 18 comments)
15. Any interesting tech blogs outside the usual software/web dev circle? (10 points | 3 comments)
16. What are you doing this week? (2 points | 1 comment)
17. go-sqlite3: Go bindings to SQLite using wazero (4 points | 1 comment)
18. Epic is suing Google and Samsung for colluding to keep new app stores off Samsung phones (1 points | 1 comment)
19. Type-erased generic functions for C: A modest non-proposal (9 points | no comments)
20. Build a serverless ACID database with this one neat trick (atomic PutIfAbsent) (8 points | no comments)
21. Gentle intro to type-level recursion in Rust (2017) (2 points | no comments)
22. Eliminating Intermediate Array Allocations (1 points | no comments)
23. Brackets are awesome, don’t use them (16 points | 22 comments)
24. Renderling Devlog, Implementing Frustum Culling using Rust-GPU (2 points | no comments)
25. Sitina1 Open-source Camera (34 points | 1 comment)
